attributes.action: Government to delay reopening of schools after Winter holidays
attributes.additional_details: Rapidly increasing cases mean many students education is impacted, especially year 11s and year 13s. Students travel by public transport to school then stay in indoor confined classrooms together for hours meaning transmission is highly probable. Students could then spread the virus on public transport, with students and teachers and with their families. Its in the best interest both for student learning and public health for schools to delay opening until stability in cases has been reached
attributes.background: On behalf of students and teachers around the country we are calling on the Government to delay the planned reopening of schools in the beginning of the new year

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Close schools and bring back online learning until the end of Jan 2022: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599364

Close schools and colleges and replace exams with teacher assessed grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603955
